reviews.text: The Locanda Borgonuovo is a wonderful place to stay in a very beautiful city. The family running the guest house are charming and very helpful. The personal touch includes the best Italian coffee with freshly made cake to wake up to, and very informed suggestions as to where to explore and where to dine. The location could not be better, just around the corner from the fabulous Piazza Cattedrale. Spotlessly clean, classy place to stay in a city which is perfect for relaxing, wandering around the Renaissance streets and gardens, and very accessible, being on the main train line from Venice to Florence. Not at all touristy, and a short hop from Ravenna and Bologna. What more can I say?
reviews.title: Fabulous Ferrara
Where to begin?
reviews.text: If you are looking for an opportunity to experience the true flavor of the region, there is not a better location than Ferrara and Locanda Borgonuovo! The city is truly beautiful. Everyone from kids to 90 year old ladies ride bicycles everywhere, contributing to the charming nature of this city. Mrs. Orlandini is one of the best hostesses we have ever encountered anywhere in Europe. From the moment that you enter the Locanda, you are truly made to feel as if you are in your own home. From touring advice in the city, to the best local restaurants, Mrs. Orlandini and her husband insure that every day here will be a wonderful experience.

The Locanda is not plush, so if you're looking for a five star experience, this is not the place. Rooms are typically European, on the small side, but bathrooms are lovely, breakfast is fabulous and the cappucino is some of the best in the city! Ferrara is a perfect base for exploring the region, being an hour or less from Venice, Verona, Ravenna and Bologna. The Locanda can also make arrangements for you to visit one of the spa villages less than an hour from the hotel, which is definitely something we will take advantage of on our next visit. The day that we visited Venice, we could not wait to get back to the Locanda! We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying here for just one night!!! If only I knew. Had spent the weekend in Balogna and had to meet friends on a Tuesday morning in Venice so we opted to stay in Ferrara for just one night.
reviews.title: Lovely Place !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a well reviewed property both in travel guides and on TripAdvisor. It earns these reviews. The hosts are knowledgable and full of good advice on everything from restaurants to museums. It is clear that they love their city and want visitors to discover it and love it as well. Because of their suggestions of places to see, Ferrara was one of the highlights of our trip to Italy.

reviews.text: Two things stand out: the bikes and the breakfasts. The Inn has several bikes for their guests to use and the city is extremely bike friendly including a bike path around the city's medieval walls. Take advantage of this. The hosts will give you a map and directions on where to ride.

reviews.text: The room and bathroom were large even by U.S. standards and the location was steps away from the beautiful Duomo and castle, near many fantastic restaurants and near great shopping. It can't be beat for location. We should also mention that it is a short 10-15 minute walk to the train station (although with bags it would be long--take the 1 or 9 bus from the station instead to the Castle and you are there).
